poem:
Echoes in Pisa

Amid ancient stones,  
young flesh reunites –  
a borrowed embrace,  
glimpse of Eden.

Timeless, they merge  
with shadows of time;  
love's fragile flame  
in the world's cold gaze,
between history's sighs,  
beneath a leaning tower.

– R.S. Thomas
